management of the EU's external borders
management of the European Union's external borders
management of the external borders of the European Union

definition: A breach of a law or rule; an illegal act.
A failure to act responsibly for someone who has given you something to keep safe, for example money or a company's secret information.
Provision of financial means to terrorists.
Insider dealing, unlawful disclosure of insider information or market manipulation
Victim compensation refers to payment or reparations made to a crime victim.
The enforcement of the obligation to return, namely the physical transportation out of the country.
Statistical time series used to monitor the social system, helping to identify changes and to guide intervention to alter the course of social change.
Enabling every citizen, notably the most disadvantaged, to fully participate in society, including having a job.
Process by which a person adopts radical positions on political or social issues.
Increase in the proportion of older persons in the total population.
A sexual minority is a group whose sexual identity, orientation or practices differ from the majority of the surrounding society.

related.prefLabel: discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation

definition: A person's usual or principal work or business.

An employee who is sent by their employer to carry out a service in another EU Member State on a temporary basis. Posted workers remain employed by the sending company and covered by the social security of their home country.
An adult male human being.
Various measures whose purpose is to improve conditions for children in society
Social security contributions are compulsory payments paid to general government that confer entitlement to receive a (contingent) future social benefit.
The coordination of social security laws of the Member States.
An organized body of people with a particular purpose, especially a business, society, association, etc.
A foundation is an organization which provides money for a special purpose such as research or charity.
A farm, business, or other organization which is owned and run jointly by its members, who share the profits or benefits.
A consortium is a group made up of two or more individuals, companies, or governments that work together to achieve a common objective.
An establishment founded for doing research. Research bodies or institutes may specialize in basic research or may be oriented to applied research.

European Company – also known as SE (Societas Europea in Latin) – is a type of public limited-liability company that allows you to run your business in different European countries using a single set of rules.
Process of expanding the richness of human life rather than simply the richness of the economy in which human beings live.
Unoccupied time during which a person may indulge in rest, recreation, etc.
The action or practice of playing gambling games.
Any entitiy responsible for the organization or oversight of any sport.
Match-fixing involves the manipulation of an outcome or contingency by competitors, teams, sports agents, support staff, referees and officials and venue staff.
Grassroots sport is physical leisure activity, organised and non-organised, practised regularly at non-professional level for health, educational or social purposes.
Sports agents act, first and foremost, as intermediaries between sportspersons and sport clubs/organisers of sport events with a view to employing or hiring an athlete or sportsperson.
A person who is very good at sports or physical exercise, especially one who competes in organized events.
Provides data covering most aspects relating to quality of life in cities.

When one country adopts a trade policy measure or takes some action that one or more fellow-World Trade Organisation members considers to be breaking the WTO agreements, or to be a failure to live up to obligations.
Any diamond that is mined in areas controlled by forces opposed to the legitimate, internationally recognized government of a country and that is sold to fund military action against that government.

The term ‘strategic autonomy’ comes from defence/
military planning and refers to the EU’s ability to chart
its own course in line with its interests and values.
An EU trade agreement containing tariff provisions more favourable than those regulated by the WTO.
Monitoring of export activities to ensure that there is no cirumvention of regulations regarding the export of goods and services either in general or to specific countries.
Taric is used by the Commission and the Member States for the purpose of applying EU measures relating to imports and exports and to trade between Member States.
synonyms: Integrated Tariff of the European Union
integrated tariff of the European Communities

definition: Tariff and statistical nomenclature applied to the external trade of the Europan Union and to the trade between Member States.
Preferential customs arrangements which the industrialised countries, including the European Union, apply to developing countries.
Activities and policies intended to help producers sell their products outside their internal market.

Smuggling is the illegal transportation of objects, substances, information or people, such as out of a house or buildings, into a prison, or across an international border, in violation of applicable laws or other regulations.
A service is an (intangible) act or use for which a consumer, firm, or government is willing to pay.
En el contexto de la política agrícola común, un bien público es cualquier bien y servicio que beneficia al público general pero por el cual el productor no recibe remuneración a través del mercado.

The balance of payments (BOP), also known as the balance of international payments, is a statement of all transactions made between entities in one country and the rest of the world over a defined period, such as a quarter or a year. It summarizes all transactions that a country's individuals, companies, and government bodies complete with individuals, companies, and government bodies outside the country.

Balance of trade (BOT) is the difference between the value of a country's exports and the value of a country's imports for a given period. Balance of trade is the largest component of a country's balance of payments (BOP). Sometimes the balance of trade between a country's goods and the balance of trade between its services are distinguished as two separate figures.
Part of the EU's efforts to create the best possible conditions for European firms to export around the world and to make sure international trade rules are enforced.
Legal protection of a passenger using any mode of public transport.
An infrastructure that supplies electric energy for the recharging of plug-in electric vehicles.

According to the International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO) terminology, ‘air safety’ is related to the operational safety of aircraft, including personnel licensing and airworthiness, whereas ‘aviation security’ means safeguarding civil aviation against acts of unlawful interference.
Railway safety is concerned with the protection of life and property through regulation, management and technology development of all forms of rail transportation.
Unmanned or remote piloted aircraft used for military or civil usage.
The combination of measures and human and material resources intended to safeguard civil aviation against acts of unlawful interference that jeopardise the security of civil aviation
Merchant shipping between neighbouring ports or EU ports.
The protection of the maritime link in the transport logistics chain from unlawful intentional acts against shipping and port operations.
References to the maximum vehicle dimensions and weights for national and international road transport in the EU.
Active transport includes non-motorised forms of transport involving physical activity, such as walking and cycling.
